definition: (of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)

sentences.english: There were knots in the rope at intervals of a foot.
sentences.chinese: 每隔一步的間隔，那條繩子上就係有一個繩結。

sentences.english: The knots were caked with dried blood.
Double bowline is used by many climbers as their primary knot.
sentences.chinese: 雙布林結通常是攀登者最初使用的繩結。

sentences.english: If rappels are necessary, check every knot and anchor point thoroughly for its security.
sentences.chinese: 如果需要繩降，通盤檢查每一個繩結和錨點的安全性。

sentences.english: However, it is quicker to tie than the above method.
sentences.chinese: 不過，用這種方法系繩結比上一種要快。

sentences.english: KNOT】The knots of your package must be tied tightly.
sentences.chinese: 你包裹上的繩結必須紮緊。

sentences.english: To cut this knot, you need a knife or a pair of scissors.
sentences.chinese: 要剪斷這個繩結，需要一把小刀或者一個剪子。

sentences.english: Simple knot to tie two ropes together. The double fisherman knot, however, is more popular.
sentences.chinese: 一種簡單的繩結，用來連接兩條繩子，但雙漁人結。

definition: variant of 圖像|图像[tu2 xiang4]
to adjust one's head and turn one's face (idiom); cosmetic changes/Despite superficially new policies, the substance remains unchanged.
to affix a seal/to stamp (a document)
to appreciate/to take pleasure in/to enjoy
to interpret (a visual document, a medical exam, an historical event etc)/to analyze data (from a chip, a black box etc)
